intro: Microcorys exserta, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and distinctive floral structures. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique arrangement typical of the spurge family. The leaves are usually narrow and succulent, aiding in water retention.
